Description: Bronze finger-ring with silver and gold plating, set with a conical garnet; the hoop has a semi-circular section which expands to a bezel; the stone is set in a small oval depression in the bezel.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Amathus
Bibliographic references: Finger Ring / Catalogue of the Finger Rings, Greek, Etruscan, and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum (1389)
Bronze / Catalogue of the Bronzes in the British Museum. Greek, Roman & Etruscan. (2303)
Laffineur et al. 1986 / Amathonte III. Testimonia 3. L'Orfèvrerie. Scarabées, scaraboïdes et cônes. La coupe en argent du British Museum (No. 517, p. 79)
